definition: made of iron/strong as iron
iron (metal)/arms/weapons/hard/strong/violent/unshakeable/determined/close/tight (slang)
surname Tie
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
lit. the yamen is strong as iron, the officials flow like water (idiom)/fig. government officials come and go
pinyin: tie3 da3 de5 ya2 men5 , liu2 shui3 de5 guan1

sentences.english: The soldier was as hard as nails.
sentences.chinese: 这位战士身体如铁打一般的强健。

sentences.english: I strive to be a iron miss. ill.
sentences.chinese: 也要努力的做铁打的病秧子。

sentences.english: Though its hands are silken, its heart is of iron.
sentences.chinese: 它的手虽柔滑，它的心却是铁打的。

sentences.english: Other people say the horseshoe is made of iron, and iron has always been regarded as a protection against evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 还有人说马蹄铁是铁打的，而铁本身就有驱邪的功能。

sentences.english: What are these guys made of?

definition: Ironman
mainstay/cornerstone/tower of strength
to be able to endure (exertion, fatigue etc)/to be able to afford
brave man, willing to risk his life
not shaken by thunder (idiom); the arrangements are unalterable/to adhere rigidly to regulations/will go ahead whatever happens (of an arrangement or plan)
to be tempered into a steel
motionless
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
resounding/loud/well known/famous
steady as Mt Tai/as safe as houses
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
man of steel/unyielding, tough guy
another name for 金箍棒[jin1 gu1 bang4]/(fig.) stabilizing force
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
a strong and determined man (idiom)
